gcci.text: At an average H100 on‑prem lease of roughly $3.16/hour, the hardware market remains tight as NVIDIA allocates scarce wafers amid rising capex, tightening supply chain resilience for hyperscalers and enterprises.

gtpi.text: With input pricing near $1.53 per million tokens, the API price wars are compressing unit costs and pushing providers toward smarter routing, fine‑tuning, and sparsity to maintain margins in a fiercely competitive market.

gagl.text: AI’s projected 120 TWh annual load will stress grids and accelerate nuclear adoption as operators seek reliable, low‑carbon baseload to meet surging compute demand while keeping carbon footprints in check.

aipi.text: Industry sentiment is mixed: rapid price declines and 120 TWh energy footprints signal durable growth, yet the surge in capex and aggressive pricing could fuel a bubble unless cost curves and ROI normalize.
